AlwaysHardcode.Help: Values, which have to be hardcoded in the DLL at compile time for technical reasons.[NEWLINE]Changing anything here will require a new DLL file.

AlwaysReadFromXML.Help: Game constants, which are always read from xml at game start.[NEWLINE]Changes here will always apply without recompiling the DLL.

CanHardcode.Help: Values, which can be hardcoded for performance reasons, but there are no technical reason to make hardcoding mandatory.[NEWLINE]Non-hardcoded DLL files will allow changes to take effect without compiling the DLL again.

SpecificYields.Help: The DLL has hardcoded yields[NEWLINE]Assign which yield goes with which hardcoded enum in the C++ code

CheaperYields.Help: List yields, which will always be cheaper than this one[NEWLINE]The game will automatically add yields here if they are consumed by a profession, which produces this yield.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Example: fur will always be cheaper than coats because there is a profession, which converts fur into coats. If you want say cotton to be more expensive than fur, then you need to specify it here because there is no profession linking fur and cotton.

GLOBAL_GENERIC_CARGO_CHAR.Help: GameFont char for generic cargo[NEWLINE](not specific yield)

bAI_AlwaysSell.Help: The AI will always sell yields of this type

bAI_CantUse.Help: Workaround for AI limitations. If the yield is used for something the AI can't figure out, then disable the yield here to avoid the AI producing yields it can't use anyway

bAI_PreciousMetal.Help: The AI values this yield higher when producing something for profit

bAI_SellUnneeded.Help: The AI will sell this yield if it has more than it needs

bBanFromCityPlot.Help: Mark a yield to NOT be able to be produced on a city plot.[NEWLINE]Automatically assigned to food and non-cargo yields.

bIsExportYield.Help: Import/Export All will apply to yields with this bool applied

bNativeEquip.Help: Natives can use this yield to equip soldier professions[NEWLINE]TODO: figure out a way to autogenerate this based on profession xml

bWeapon.Help: Stored yields of this type counts towards military value
